Reviews.Title: “Grubby smelly & small”
Reviews.Author: Africapaddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. Great location but terrible small & grubby room Well worn & needs Room upgrade. Dirty carpets & smelly shower curtains in room 322...

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: michelleatzmon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to the Arc de Triomphe. Small and intimate hotel, rooms small clean

Reviews.Title: “lovely little french style hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayaust
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel on our very first visit to Paris and loved this hotel, is small and cute and in the best location you could walk everywhere or get on the train in mins, air france bus from airport drops you mins from this hotel would recommend this hotel in a , just remember this is a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TeresaEDurham
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my student group in March 2011. We loved it! Great location-- just a couple of blocks from the Arc de Triomphe, with the Charles de Gaulle metro right there. Great breakfasts each morning. Just what I was looking for in a hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I would return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtwotravl
Reviews.Content: Other than the front desk staff being your typical Parisians, and rude, the housekeeping person who was from Shri Lanka was the kindest, most helpful person. He told us about the airport bus located just one and a half blocks away which was perfect for airport transit and much cheaper than a cab ( 45 euros for 3 people one way) It was cheaper if you did round trip. Our room was tiny! (have a 12 year old who slept on a cot) but the bathroom was surprisingly large. The room was very clean and very quiet and the price was excellent for Paris. Also, location was superb, right off the Champs d'Elysees and the Arc de Triompe. ( well worth the trip to the top). Also a metro is very close and easy to get to other tourist attractions....AC was working in our room very well, and we said no to the 18 euro breakfast, but ate at a nearby cafe for 6 euros each. If you see the Indian housekeeper, he is super friendly, and in fact has worked there for 20 years. Maybe he needs to be at the front desk instead, that would really make guests feel at home. P.S. when I tried to print my boarding passes I could not from the hotel computer and the person behind the front desk was not helpful at all and sent me to a cyber cafe to print. I was upset with the manner in which she treated us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & nice staff”
Reviews.Author: whirlwindkel
Reviews.Content: I choose the Hotel Princesse Caroline because I couldn't get a decent rate on another hotel that was recommended in the area. This one was more reasonably priced and just steps away from the Arch de Triomphe. The location was fantastic and the staff was friendly and helpful. They were very patient with non-French speaking visitors. The room was delightful. I felt like I was in my own bedroom in a Victorian house. It was quite roomy for a European hotel room. I rated the room 4 instead of 5 though because it might be a little too feminine for male travelers. The hotel also loses a few points for service because it didn't provide an iron and the laundry service had limited hours, therefore I had to resort to trying to turn my bathroom into a steamroom to get wrinkles out of my clothes. I would definitely go back and recommend this hotel to friends. In fact, I had tried to book a room when I returned to Paris a few days later but the hotel was booked! Overall thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “One of the few decent reasonably priced hotels in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Merciaman
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris regularly and have stayed at a number of hotels around Etoile. They are either very expensive or very small, noisy and sometimes dirty. The Princesse Caroline is a good compromise which I have stayed at 4 times now. The rooms I have had have varied from small to large, but have not been the tiny "just fits a bed " that many hotels provide in the area. The rooms are always clean. The antique furniture makes a nice change from the "Holiday Inn" style desk and chair. Bathrooms again are small, but not as small as many. Reception staff are always helpful and I have never yet had cause to complain about anything. Some of the rooms are certainly air conditioned, but I cannot remember if this applies to all. The breakfast is about average for a Paris hotel but is expensive, so I usually take breakfast in one of the many cafe's nearby. The Hotel is very close to the Charles de Gaulle Etoile RER/Metro station which allows me to get to anywhere in Paris very easily, this being one of the main reasons I stay there. If you have trouble climbing stairs, you should be aware that the lift does not go all the way to the top floor, so top floor rooms are accessed by a staircase.

Reviews.Title: “um... city of love?”
Reviews.Author: hunniersx
Reviews.Content: this hotel was terrible. it was tiny the lift was broken the aircon was broken it was loud and it stank. my fiance and i were forced to sleep in single beds which dipped on the sides so we couldnt even push them together, there was no apology no upgrade no nothing to make up for all the things that were wrong. and ladies make sure you take your own hairdryer. on the upside it was in a great location and if i return to paris i will be staying at a hotel near by. so please feel free to look up the location of the princesse caroline to get location ideas but i beg u do not stay there. the hotel photos are very deceiving ....

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: hoppalongkate
Reviews.Content: Not a bad little non-chain hotel based in a fabulous location just by the Arc de Triomphe off Rue Wagram. We had a superior room at the back which was wonderfully quiet. It was clean. Bathroom tiny but they all are round here. Breakfast was one of the worst I have ever seen so don't bother, plus its in a horrible pokey basement room. Great Japanese takeaway opposite. Because it looks independent the decoration has a few quirky touches but I rather liked that. I've stayed in 4 hotels round here now and this was certainly the best value by far this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel wonderful, breakfast overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Finicular
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel convenient - a couple of minutes walk from L'Etoile and certainly living up to its good reviews, with a pleasant slightly dated decor, and the staff unfailingly friendly and helpful - in fact they actually changed my room three times without a murmur! The first room was stuffy and smelt strongly of air freshener - I suspected an effort to disguise some illicit smokers. (One of the unforseen downsides of the smioking ban is that instead of being confined to smoking rooms smokers are now put everywhere and inevitably some break the rules - so perhaps non smokers also are actually worse off?) The second room was fine, but had twin beds,and as I was being joined by my girlfriend for the second night, I asked for a double bed. The request was granted the following morning without delay and we were put at the back of the hotel and avoided incidental street noise so was even better off. My only grouse was that the window frame in the bathroom was rotting and in need of replacement, However, unless you're in a hurry, I suggest you avoid the breakfast, which is overpriced at 18 Euros and a distinctly uninteresting buffet,.

Reviews.Title: “our romantic week end in Paris”
Reviews.Author: the_crazy_traveller
Reviews.Content: We left hotel Princess Caroline yesterday at noon. We alreday miss that lovely place that has been our home for the last 3 days. Centrally located just few minutes walk from the Arch of Triumph and the Champs Elisees, we do think this is the right place for those people as we are that like to indulge in bed and relax as much as possible. The hotel, even in the heart of the city is in a very quite position and the old decors make you feel to be in a different age. Carla and Valerie, the two ladies at the reception has been as helpful as ever, booking the baton-mouche soirÃ¨ upon our arrival and giving all the advices possible to let us enjoy all without any stress. We walked all around for miles and miles and really enjoyed our last walk trough avenue Wagram to the Louvre to watch at the most romantic sunset we have ever seen in our life. Our room 347 (sorry for I took the key as a souvenir) was at the 4Â° floor,very clean, with a lovely king size bed, a sofa for two and a complete bathroom. We don't really know much buffet breakfast, we got room service everyday from a lovely waither, even out of breakfast time...... so relaxing..... We will definitely be back soon, and at Princess Caroline for sure Thanks for making our week end so romantic as we expected

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Familylikestotravel
Reviews.Content: this hotel was really a lift up for us after staying 2 nights in a crappy hotel at montmarte area which is also a 3 star hotel...the worst one..... i still remember what I've said to my myself at the first time I step into the lobby of Princesse Caroline hotel. "Thank God"...this hotel really blew my mind...for a 3 star hotel...me and my wife really enjoyed every minute we had over there....the room is fairly roomy and a lot cleaner compared with our previous hotel. The housekeeping will kindly change your bed sheet and pillow cases everyday if you ask them...we left them tips for their kindness. the continental Breakfast was really satisfying unlimited supply of croissant, boilled egg, cereal, etc.... the receptionist was really helpful, she help us by showing us the direction to the closest auto laundry service and internet cafe. located only 2 minutes walk from Metro(underground train) and Arc de Triomph) very convenient bottom line this hotel really is Value for money...whenever we come to paris...we definetely will stay at Princess Caroline again

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Princesse Caroline
HotelInfo.Address: 1 bis rue Troyon | 17th Arr., 75017 Paris, France
